title: House expected to vote on next coronavirus relief bill Friday, top Democrat says
description:
A top House Democrat said he expects lawmakers to return to Washington Friday to consider the next sweeping coronavirus relief bill. Rep. Steny Hoyer (D, Md.), the second-ranking Democrat in the House, told reporters bill writers hope to finish up work on the bill text by this afternoon, and lawmakers should be ready to return Friday for a vote on it.The bill is expected to be a large one, possibly bigger than the $1.8 trillion bill passed by Congress in late March. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D, Calif.) has said it will focus on testing, money for unemployment benefits and for payments to individuals and money for state and local governments as a "think big" approach

title: Pence keeping distance from Trump for 'few days' after staffer's positive test: White House
description:
Vice President Mike Pence is keeping his distance from President Donald Trump for "a few days," White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany said Tuesday, following a Pence staffer's testing positive for the coronavirus last week. McEnany told reporters that the length of time Pence distances from Trump is up to the vice president. The White House announced Friday that Pence's press secretary, Katie Miller, had tested positive. She is married to Stephen Miller, a top Trump adviser.
